requirements.summary: Revamp Screen 1 into a fully responsive kawaii Valentine aesthetic with pastel gradient, heart doodle decorations, rounded corners, soft shadows, and consistent minimal typography.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile and desktop widths, Screen 1 content stays centered and readable without overflow or clipped UI.
Background uses a pastel pink gradient and includes visible heart doodles/cute decorations.
UI uses consistently rounded corners and soft shadows across interactive elements (buttons/cards).
Typography is minimal/clean and consistent across both screens and gift views.

file_operations.description: Refactor Screen 1 container/layout styling to match the kawaii pastel gradient aesthetic; ensure responsive centering/spacing and shared typography tokens across screens and gifts.
Add/adjust global Valentine theme styles: pastel gradient helpers, heart doodle background layering support, rounded/soft-shadow defaults, and shared animation utilities for smooth/poppy transitions.

requirements.summary: Update Screen 1 content: add “14 FEB” calendar icon, bunny/heart sticker visuals near heading, and set centered copy to exactly the specified two-line text.
acceptanceCriteria: A “14 FEB” calendar icon is visible in a top corner on Screen 1 and remains well-positioned on mobile.
At least two sticker-style visuals (bunny/heart) appear near the heading and do not overlap the main text on mobile.
Main centered text matches exactly: first line “Hey there,” and second line “Will you be my Valentine?”.

file_operations.description: Create Screen 1 component with: top-corner calendar icon image (frontend/public/assets/generated/calendar-14-feb-kawaii.dim_256x256.png), sticker visuals near heading (frontend/public/assets/generated/bunny-sticker.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-sticker.dim_512x512.png), and centered copy exactly “Hey there,\nWill you be my Valentine?”; ensure mobile-safe positioning. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new Screen1 component into the app as the initial view, replacing the prior Screen 1 markup while preserving overall app structure.

requirements.summary: Update Screen 1 CTAs to exactly two prominent rounded buttons labeled “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”, with YES slightly larger and both mobile-tappable.
acceptanceCriteria: Screen 1 shows exactly two primary options with labels “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”.
YES button is visually larger than NO button (e.g., size, emphasis) and looks more inviting.
Both buttons have large touch targets suitable for mobile (no tiny tap areas).

file_operations.description: Implement exactly two rounded buttons with labels “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”; style YES as slightly larger/more inviting while keeping both as large touch targets on mobile. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Preserve and adapt the evasive “NO THANK YOU” interaction for hover and touch/press attempts, keeping it effectively unclickable and within visible bounds.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop hover/pointer enter, the “NO THANK YOU” button relocates before it can be clicked.
On touch devices, attempting to tap/press “NO THANK YOU” causes it to move away before a click completes.
The button does not move off-screen or become permanently unreachable due to positioning; it remains visible within the interaction area.

file_operations.description: Create a small hook to manage evasive button positioning within a container (bounded random repositioning with padding, respecting common mobile viewports) and expose handlers for pointer hover and touch/press attempts.

Integrate the evasive behavior hook into the “NO THANK YOU” button: move on pointer enter for desktop and on touch/press attempt for mobile; ensure it remains within container bounds and does not become reachable/clickable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Replace the post-YES meme view with Screen 2 featuring the specified headline, animated heart character on the left, and three interactive gift cards with smooth transitions/pop animations.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “YES OF COURSE” navigates to/updates the UI to Screen 2 (no meme-only success screen).
Screen 2 headline text matches exactly with the specified line break.
An animated heart character is visible on the left side on desktop and reflows appropriately on mobile (e.g., above or alongside content without overlap).
Three prominent gift cards labeled “Gift 1”, “Gift 2”, “Gift 3” are visible and tappable, with rounded corners and soft shadows.
Screen 2 entry and gift-card interactions include noticeable smooth transitions/pop animations.

file_operations.description: Create Screen 2 component with headline text exactly “Yay, you said yes!\nI made all these for you hehe”, a left-side heart character image (frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-character.dim_512x512.png) animated via CSS, and three large rounded gift cards labeled “Gift 1”, “Gift 2”, “Gift 3” with hover/tap pop animations. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Replace the current answered/meme success state with Screen 2 state; wire YES OF COURSE to transition into Screen 2 with smooth entry animation.
Add animation keyframes/utilities for Screen 2 entry (soft fade/slide) and gift card pop interactions (hover/tap), aligned with the app’s rounded/soft-shadow kawaii style.

requirements.summary: Implement Gift 1 as a modal/popup or dedicated view from Screen 2 with a rose bouquet centerpiece, four exact message bubbles around it, and floating hearts animation.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 1” shows a bouquet of red roses with a ribbon as the central visual.
All four message bubbles are present and match the provided text exactly (including punctuation).
Message bubbles are positioned around the bouquet and remain readable on mobile (stack/reflow allowed).
Floating hearts animation is visible while Gift 1 view is open.

file_operations.description: Create Gift 1 view with centered bouquet image (frontend/public/assets/generated/rose-bouquet-ribbon.dim_1024x1024.png), four surrounding message bubbles containing exactly: “I will always love you no matter what”, “You are the best part of my life”, “You will forever be my only option”, “I can’t imagine my life without you”; include floating hearts animation while open. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add floating-hearts animation utilities used by Gift 1 (and reusable elsewhere), ensuring decorations do not obscure text on mobile.
Wire “Gift 1” card interaction to open Gift 1 view (modal/popup or dedicated overlay) with soft transitions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 2” shows a card-style UI containing a short love letter.
Love letter tone matches: sweet/simple/emotional (avoid overly exaggerated or crude phrasing).
Sparkles and small hearts decorations/animations are visible on the Gift 2 view without obstructing the text on mobile.

file_operations.description: Create Gift 2 view with a cute card UI containing a short love letter (sweet, simple, emotional, not cringe) and decorative sparkles/hearts using the sparkles asset (frontend/public/assets/generated/sparkles-doodles.dim_512x512.png) with subtle animations that stay clear of the text on mobile. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 3” displays both lines exactly: “Happy Valentine’s Day ❤️” and “You’re my favorite person”.
A heart burst animation plays when Gift 3 opens.
Confetti hearts animation is visible on Gift 3 view.

Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire “Gift 3” card interaction to open Gift 3 view with smooth transitions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add heart-burst and confetti animation utilities used by Gift 3, ensuring animations are noticeable but not obstructive on mobile.

requirements.summary: Add navigation affordances so each gift view can close/go back to Screen 2 with consistent smooth pop transitions and without full reload.
acceptanceCriteria: Each gift view includes a clear way to close/go back to Screen 2.
Returning to Screen 2 preserves the same general styling and does not require a full page reload.
Open/close transitions feel smooth and consistent with the rest of the experience.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable modal/overlay wrapper with a close control and soft open/close transitions to host Gift 1/2/3 views, returning to Screen 2 without page reload. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the GiftOverlay wrapper to open/close Gift 1/2/3 views from Screen 2 and handle back/close interactions consistently. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
